algorithm

Class Simulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithm.Simulation

  • public class Simulation
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulation: encapsulates a map or network of roads that have traffic and other properties, and simulates the motion or flow of traffic based on a set of pre-defined rules. NOTE: this class is designed to be used in a console application where the console application simply initializes an instance of this object and then calls the "Run()" method.
    Author:
    Nathan Minor

      • isPathClear

        private boolean isPathClear(boolean isPassing,
                  boolean isPassingLeft,
                  Car currentCar,
                  Position currentPosition,
                  Road currentRoad)
        This method is used to check ALL of the tiles/spaces a car would travel through if it were changing lanes. A flag (isLeft) is used to distinguish between passing on the right versus passing on the left.
        Parameters:
        isPassingLeft -
        currentCar -
        currentPosition -
        currentRoad -
        Returns:

      • calculateStats

        private void calculateStats()
        Calculates the summary data for the simulation after it completes all the iterations specified by the user (via the constructor). This is the final data that will be saved in the XML file for this simulation.
